div.l: But or þou goo othing I wol þe telle
Whan þat þou wendest homward bi þe welle
Right at the entre of þe dore behinde
Thou shalt a cake of half abusshel finde
Þat was I maked of þin owne mele
Which þat I helpe my sire for to stele
And good lemman god þe saue and kepe
And wiþ þat word almost she gan to wepe
Aleyn vp rist and þought or þat it dawe
I wil go crepen in by my felawe
And fonde þe cradel with his honde anoon
Bigod þought he al wrong I haue mysgoon
Min heed is toti of my swynk to night
That makeþ me þat I go not a right
I woot wel bi the cradel I haue mysgo
Here lith þe Millere and his wif also
And forth he goþ on twenti deuele way
Vnto the bedde þ̉ere as þe Millere lay
He wende haue cropen bi his felawe Iohn
And bi þe Mellere in he crepe anoon
And caught him bi þe necke and softe he spak
He seide þou Iohn þou swyneshed a wak
For cristes saule and hire a noble game
For bi þat lorde þat called is seint Iame
As I haue þries in þis short night
Swyued þe Mellers doughter bolt vp right
Whil þou hast as a coward ben agast
Ye false harlot ꝙquod þe Mellere hast
A fals traitoᵘur fals clerc ꝙquod he
Þou shalt be ded bi goddes dignite
Who durst be so bolde to disparage
Mi doughter þat is comen of swiche lynage
And bi þe þrote bolle he caught Aleyn
And he hēnt him despitousli ageyn
